claim.text: white paint at 85% reflectance minimum; specular aluminum reaches 95%
claim.claim: White paint has minimum 85% reflectance; specular aluminum reaches 95% reflectance

results.summary: Both reflectance values align with established technical specifications for these materials.
results.detail: White paint reflectance of 85% minimum is consistent with cool roof standards - ENERGY STAR requires minimum 65% initial solar reflectance for low-slope roofs, while high-quality white coatings typically achieve 80-90%. Specular (polished) aluminum mirrors typically achieve 90-95% reflectance across visible wavelengths, with high-quality first-surface aluminum mirrors reaching up to 95%. These are well-established material science values.

claim.text: Edmonton's latitude (53°N) offers low winter sun angles ideal for light-shelf geometry — the December noon sun at 13° above the horizon
claim.claim: Edmonton is at latitude 53°N and December noon sun angle is 13° above horizon

results.summary: Edmonton's latitude of approximately 53°N and the December noon sun angle of 13° are both accurate based on astronomical calculation.
results.detail: Edmonton's latitude is approximately 53.5°N (often rounded to 53°N), which is accurate. The winter solstice noon sun altitude can be calculated using the formula: altitude = 90° - latitude + declination. At 53.5°N with winter solstice declination of -23.5°, this yields 90 - 53.5 - 23.5 = 13°. The claim is mathematically correct and consistent with standard solar geometry.
sources: Astronomical calculation using standard solar altitude formula
